channel.title: Wladyslaw Lizon
channel.description: Recent news about Wladyslaw Lizon, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Mentioned by Mississauga
item.description:
Don't cry wolf
Mississauga News. ByNeville Narques, Mississauga. Dear Editor: Re: “Unfair portrayal,” letter published in the Aug. 14 edition of The News. It's obvious the writer did not understood the content of Mississauga East-Cooksville MP Wladyslaw Lizon's newsletter.

item.title: Mentioned by Mississauga
item.description:
Serious issue
The letter sent by Mississauga-East Cooksville MP Wladyslaw Lizon clearly states that “bogus asylum claimants” will not be tolerated. It did not say all asylum claimants will be denied. The waiting time for Canadian citizenship applicants is close to two or three ...

item.title: Mentioned by Mississauga
item.description:
Times have changed
Let me compare the Canada that welcomed me in 1967 with the current Canada that is governed by Prime Minister Stephen Harper, Immigration Minister Jason Kenney and Mississauga East-Cooksville MP Wladyslaw Lizon. In the 1960s, only Sweden and ...

item.title: Mentioned by Mississauga
item.description:
What's the problem?
Perhaps the writer read a different flyer from Mississauga East-Cooksville MP Wladyslaw Lizon than I did. I found no “uninformed and hateful” portrayal and disrespect towards legitimate immigrants and refugees. Frankly, I applaud the federal government's ...

item.description:
MP embarks on emotional military march
MISSISSAUGA — Wladyslaw Lizon is leaving the comforts of Parliament Hill for the rigours of the battlefield. The MP for Mississauga East-Cooksville left today for the Netherlands where he will join up with more than 200 Canadian soldiers to follow in the ...
